show.title: Back to the Future
show.headline: 1.21 gigawatts of pure cinematic bliss

event.title: <show-title>Back to the Future</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Come get heavy with Marty and Doc
event.description:
"1.21 gigawatts!”

Over 30 years ago, Michael J. Fox and Christopher Lloyd took us on an era-hopping adventure with BACK TO THE FUTURE as the '80s raddest time travelin' teen and his unlikely sidekick - a crazy, wild-eyed, wild-haired scientist. What rose from those flame trails is the heaviest sci-fi comedy ever made - one that is often considered "the perfect movie" without hyperbole.

Now, you’re invited to get even heavier with us at these fourth wall-busting celebrations of time-hopping DeLoreans, life jacket vests, and oedipal overtones. Come floor it with us right to 88 MPH with a Johnny B. Goode air guitar contest before the show, and themed props to bring the movie magic to life, like your very own vial of Plutonium!**

**Not guaranteed to actually transport you back in time.

It’s the raucously fun celebration you might not be ready for, but your kids – your kids are gonna love it.

show.title: Shogun Assassin
show.headline: Blood spattered samurai mayhem!

event.title: <show-title>Shogun Assassin</show-title>
event.headline: Blood spattered samurai mayhem!
event.description: A bad time for the empire made for a good time for western audiences who in 1980 were treated to this arterial spray soaked 85-minute distillation of two feature length Japanese movies from 1972 based on the Lone Wolf and Cub manga series. A re-cut, condensed, dubbed version of multiple foreign movies based on a comic book sounds like it'd be a hot mess, but through some magic alchemy (and the addition of a bumping, new analog synth soundtrack) SHOGUN ASSASSIN stands as a uniquely badass work of its own. Ogami the Lone Wolf is a master samurai whose prowess and very existence threaten the paranoid Shogun. The Shogun sentences Ogami to death and murders his wife forcing him to flee across the country with his toddler son, consumed with rage and desire for vengeance. The outlaw samurai roams the countryside pushing his child around in a baby carriage and dismembering, disemboweling, and decapitating anyone who gets in his way. The compact story rarely pauses for story or character development and instead relishes in showing conflict after conflict between Ogami and the colorful group of would-be assassins that greet him around every corner. Blades fly and bright red blood squirts from so many necks, stumps and faces as he carves his way across feudal Japan. This is the stuff dreams are made of. (Laird Jimenez)

show.title: Pitch Perfect
show.headline: Are you ready to get pitch slapped?

event.title: <show-title>Pitch Perfect</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Are you ready to get pitch slapped?
event.description:
Are you ready to get pitch-slapped? Join us for an aca-awesome and totally interactive screening of PITCH PERFECT, where making music with your mouth isn't just encouraged, it's downright mandatory. Sing along to your favorite lady jams with the Barden Bellas and the Treblemakers because we're Dixie Chick-serious about loving this movie.

You want to be a Barden Bella? Well there'll be a riff off in the theater, so prepare your musical skills. We'll also induct you with your very own Bella scarf and of course, a plastic cup so you can sing along to "When I'm Gone." It's going to be aca-mazing!

event.title: <show-title>Downton Abbey: A New Era</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: You are cordially invited to an advance screening – formal attire required
event.description: We would be honoured to host you and other Downton Abbey enthusiasts at an exclusive advance screening. You’ll see it before anyone else, but be sure to wear your finest formal attire. We won’t turn you away if you’re wearing jeans, but we will shoot disapproving looks and pointed barbs your way all night if you do. We’ll have a special themed menu of light refreshments available to order from, and all guests will receive a limited-run print of a custom-designed letterpress recipe card.

show.title: Fist of Fury
show.headline: Bruce Lee's kick-ass kung fu classic

event.title: <show-title>Fist of Fury</show-title>
event.headline: Bruce Lee's kick-ass kung fu classic
event.description:
Returning to Shanghai to marry his fiancée, Chen Zhen (Bruce Lee) a student of martial arts teacher Huo Yuanjia. Once arriving he finds his master has died of an apparent illness, and his funeral ruined by a rival dojo. Soon after Chen discovers the truth, that the dojo's master ordered his teacher's poisoning. Chen then sets out on a blood fueled quest to seek revenge

Bruce Lee's performance in FIST OF FURY is a genre-defining role for Lee. This is one of the first films Bruce Lee was given creative power over the choreographed the fight scenes. Resulting in one of the most realistic kung fu films that should not be missed.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Poltergeist (1982)
show.headline: PG-rated horror has never been so scary.

event.title: <show-title>Poltergeist (1982)</show-title>
event.headline: PG-rated horror has never been so scary
event.description:
"They're here!"

Forty years ago, Steven Spielberg harvested some of his unused ideas from a pre-E.T. alien invasion film about an ordinary family pitted against the unknown, added in some supernatural elements from his darkest fears, and hired Tobe Hooper to direct. The result is the all-time American horror classic, POLTERGEIST - screening this May via a gorgeous new 4K restoration courtesy of Warner Brothers.

JoBeth Williams and Craig T. Nelson star as the Freelings, whose average suburban family is tested when unexplained phenomena begin to manifest in their house. What begins as curiosity turns to terror when their young daughter (played wonderfully by Heather O'Rourke) goes missing. Together, the family must rally their strength to rescue the child from the demonic entity preying upon their home.

Don't miss a fortieth-anniversary screening of one of the greatest ghost movies ever made. There's a reason this movie is a classic, folks.

show.title: The Iron Giant
show.headline: It came from outer space

event.title: <show-title>The Iron Giant</show-title>
event.headline: It came from outer space
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Cold War paranoia comes to a fever pitch in a small Maine fishing town in director Brad Bird’s (THE INCREDIBLES) beautifully crafted and beloved animated adventure about friendship, choosing your own destiny, and testing your mettle.

In October of 1957, America had plenty to be worried about. Rock 'n' roll. Television. The bomb. Sputnik. The Cold War. In the small town of Rockwell, Maine, Annie Hughes (Jennifer Aniston) is just worried about putting supper on the table for herself and her headstrong and imaginative nine-year-old son, Hogarth. Inspired by a fisherman’s wild tale, Hogarth sets off into the woods and finds a 50-foot giant with an insatiable appetite for metal and a childlike curiosity about its new world. As the Iron Giant (Vin Diesel) is discovered by government agents, friendly beatniks, and the military, he’ll have to decide whether he wants to be a gun, or a hero. In times like these, you really find out what your friends are made of… and sometimes, it's metal.

Underappreciated in its time, THE IRON GIANT is now widely considered one of the quintessential animated classics of the late ‘90s, and for good reason. The gorgeous animation, engaging story, and timeless themes are as excellent today as they were in 1999. Paired with an outstanding voice cast that also included Christopher McDonald and Harry Connick Jr.and you’ve got an all-time great that your whole family will love.

show.title: Cats
show.headline: The hit Broadway meow-sical comes to cinematic life

event.title: <show-title>Cats</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Featuring claw-some props and audience purr-ticipation
event.description:
Calling all Jellicles! The meow-sical event of the year has arrived with Tom Hooper’s star-studded adaptation of Andrew Lloyd Weber’s beloved musical, CATS. And we are going to celebrate in style.

At our CATS Movie Party, we’ll have cat ears to make you feel like an honorary Jellicle, glow necklaces and LED rings to light up the theater during your favorite songs, and name tags so that you can come up with your very own cat name (“Rum Tum Tugger” is taken). With fun props and interactive elements, you and your friends will feel like you’ve ascended to the Heaviside Layer.

show.title: Hotel Transylvania
show.headline: Where monsters go to get away from it all

event.title: <show-title>Hotel Transylvania</show-title>
event.headline: Where monsters go to get away from it all
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Director Genndy Tartakovsky’s (Star Wars: Clone Wars, Dexter's Laboratory) HOTEL TRANSYLVANIA is a hilarious, spooky, and utterly original 3D take on the world's most famous vampire. Dracula (Adam Sandler) runs an upscale supernatural resort for monsters and their families. But when an ordinary boy (Andy Samberg, reuniting with Sandler after THAT'S MY BOY) stumbles on the resort and falls for Dracula's daughter Mavis (Selena Gomez), Dracula gets a little over-protective.

Also starring the hilarious voice talents of Steve Buscemi, Kevin James, David Spade, Fran Drescher, Jon Lovitz, and Molly Shannon, HOTEL TRANSYLVANIA is an all-star laugh riot and a triumph of pure spectacle for all ages. Utilizing incredible animation inspired by pioneers like Tex Avery and Chuck Jones, the visuals are instantly recognizable, iconic, and delightful to watch.

show.title: Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway
show.headline: James Corden returns as the lovable long-eared rogue

event.title: <show-title>Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway</show-title>
event.headline: James Corden returns as the lovable long-eared rogue
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

An all-star cast, including Rose Byrne, Margot Robbie, Domhnall Gleeson, and David Oyelowo, lend their voice talents to this fleet-footed adventure that’ll leave you feeling warm and fuzzy.

Bea, Thomas, and the rabbits have created a makeshift family, but despite his best efforts, Peter (James Corden) can’t seem to shake his mischievous reputation. Adventuring out of the garden, Peter finds himself in a world where his mischief is appreciated, but when his family risks everything to come looking for him, Peter must figure out what kind of bunny he wants to be.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Space Jam
show.headline: Definitively, the Michael Jordan of animated sports films

event.title: <show-title>Space Jam</show-title>
event.headline: Definitively, the Michael Jordan of animated sports films
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Get ready to jam.

If there was any possible way to make the Looney Tunes more incredible it would be to team them up with the greatest basketball player the world has ever known, Mr. Michael Jordan.

The evil Swackhammer, owner of the amusement park planet Moron Mountain, is desperate for a new attraction, so he sends his henchmen, the Nerdlucks, to Looney Tune Land for some forcible recruitment. Bugs and the crew are far from excited and hatch a plan to challenge the diminutive Nerdlucks to a game of basketball to determine their fate. The Tunes think they have it in the bag until the Nerdlucks use their strange powers to steal the talents of Charles Barkley, Patrick Ewing, Muggsy Bogues, Larry Johnson, and Shawn Bradley to transform themselves into the ultra-muscular, insanely tall, mega-basketball playing slam-dunking ultra team, The Monstars. So it's up to our carrot chomping leader to recruit the only man than can save Tune-kind, Michael Jordan.

What follows is perhaps the greatest game of basketball ever played in this universe. It's an all-rabbit, behind-the-back, double alley-oop of a-time that you will never forget. You may have seen some great games in your life, but you have never seen anything like this. Come on and slam, and welcome to the jam. (Greg MacLennan)

show.title: Tom & Jerry: The Movie
show.headline: Best of enemies, worst of friends for eighty years

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Rev 1 TAJ T1 0104 High Res JPEG

event.title: <show-title>Tom & Jerry: The Movie</show-title>
event.headline: Best of enemies, worst of friends for eighty years
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Ali and Frazier. Holmes and Moriarty. Bette and Joan. Tom and Jerry.

One of the most heated (and beloved) rivalries in history is reignited when Jerry moves into New York City's finest hotel on the eve of "the wedding of the century," forcing the event's desperate planner to hire Tom to get rid of him. The ensuing cat and mouse battle threatens to destroy her career, the wedding and possibly the hotel itself. But soon, an even bigger problem arises: a diabolically ambitious staffer conspiring against all three of them.

An eye-popping blend of classic animation and live action from director Tim Story and co-starring Chloë Grace Moretz, Tom and Jerry's new big-screen adventure stakes new ground for the iconic characters and forces them to do the unthinkable... work together to save the day.

show.title: Minions
show.headline: Hang out with Stuart, Kevin & Bob before they met Gru

event.title: <show-title>Minions</show-title>
event.headline: Hang out with Stuart, Kevin & Bob before they met Gru
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Minions were born to serve. It’s in the name. So what happens when our favorite yellow troublemakers have no one to follow? Mischief, and lots of it.

Before they found Gru, the Minions worked for all the worst bad guys – from T-Rex to Napoleon – but nothing ever seemed to work out. Depressed and leaderless in Antarctica, Kevin, Stuart, and Bob set out to Villain-Con to compete for the honor to serve the ultimate evildoer – the world’s first ever female supervillain, Scarlet Overkill. Their journey will take them on a dangerous and hilarious path through the swinging ‘60s of New York and London that jeopardizes all of Minionkind.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.
